title: For Sale/Trade:  Antique Knights of Father Mathew Sword
postcontent:
This is a ceremonial sword presented to high-ranking members of the Knights of Father Mathew, which was a Catholic Temperance Society. They believed in complete abstinence from alcohol, and movements such as this eventually brought about prohibition to the United States.

Each of these swords have a member's name on one side of the blade, and "Knights of Father Mathew" on the reverse side of the blade. This sword belonged to a T.J. Molloy from the St. Louis, Mo. Council Chapter. By Googling the name on the blade, I was actually able to find reference to the original owner on a genealogy site here:

http://familytreemaker.genealogy.com/users/s/u/t/Deborah-J-Sutter/WEBSITE-0001/UHP-0046.html

According to the information presented there, the original owner of this sword passed away in 1911, which means the item is well over 100 years old. 

The sword shows some wear for its age. The guard and knight's head shaped pommel have become somewhat oxidized, and the blade has minor aging marks, but no battle scars or signs of rough handling are present. The original hilt-wrap is actually in very good shape. The overall balance of the weapon is impressive for a ceremonial piece. They really don't make presentation swords of this quality anymore, and it this one's form and function has stood the test of time.

A relative of the Molloy family may want to reclaim this sword, or perhaps a collector of Catholic antique memorabilia. As a sword enthusiast myself, I am hesitant to even offer this item for sale, however I need the money.

Not to be disrespectful, but I could also see a tavern or bar owner purchasing this item for display, as a tribute to the fallen opposition of such establishments. Or it could hang in your man cave above your liquor cabinet. 

Asking $125, or will trade for silver, or...?

Reply to ad, call, or text to (918) 804 Nine Four Six Two.

Thanks for looking!
